entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 15 at 9:49PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Slick Roadways Tonight Due to Refreezing Snow... Temperatures have continued to fall at or below freezing across our northern portions of eastern Iowa this evening. entry.summary: ...LAKE-EFFECT SNOW SHOWERS SHIFTING INTO EAST-CENTRAL WISCONSIN... .The lake-effect snow showers that affected parts of northeast Wisconsin Tuesday evening were shifting south. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 12:21AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SLICK AND SNOW COVERED ROADS ACROSS NORTHLAND... Roads are becoming ice and snow covered early this morning as previously melted snow refreezes and is covered with a fresh layer of actively falling snow. entry.cap:areaDesc: Ashland; Bayfield; Burnett; Douglas; Iron; Price; Sawyer; Washburn

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 12:20AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Slippery Roadways Expected from New and Refreezing Snow... Area roads are snow covered and slippery, with patches of ice from snow that melted during the day. The road condition maps put out by our DOT partners are indicating most roadways being at least partially covered, with conditions slowly deteriorating as more light snow continues to fall.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Barron; Chippewa; Dunn; Eau Claire; Pepin; Pierce; Polk; Rusk; St. Croix

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 15 at 9:34PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Slick Roadways from Refreezing Snow... Roads are developing slick spots as ongoing light snow falls on wet roadways that are refreezing. Multiple spin outs have been reported along Interstate-90 this evening and DOTs are reporting steadily deteriorating road conditions throughout the region. entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeast Bighorn Mountains; Sheridan Foothills
